pylapp.smoothclicker.android.tools.screen

Class AsyncTaskForScreen<T,U,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • <any>
      • pylapp.smoothclicker.android.tools.screen.AsyncTaskForScreen<T,U,V>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ATClicker, ATScreenWatcher

    public abstract class AsyncTaskForScreen<T,U,V>
extends <any>
    Async Task which consists on working on the device and more on its screen of displayed elements.
    Since:
    13/06/2016
    Version:
    1.1.0
    Author:
    pylapp
    See Also:
    AsyncTask

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private BRScreenOff mBrScreenOff
      The receiver which will deal with the screen-off events
      protected Activity mContext
      The application context
      private boolean mIsBrScreenOffRegistered
      Flag which indicates if the broadcast receiver dedicated to screen-off events is registered

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AsyncTaskForScreen(Activity c) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected boolean checkIfCancelled()
      Checks if the task has been canceled or must finish.
      protected void disableForceScreenOn()
      Disable the lock which made the screen always on
      protected void displayToast(java.lang.String m)
      Displays a toast with a dedicated message
      protected void forceScreenOnIfNeeded()
      Forces the screen's state to make it always on if needed (i.e. if the settings have the dedicated option activated).
      protected void forceScreenState()
      Forces the screen state making the screen on and unlocking the device (if needed).
      protected void forceScreenUnlockIfNeeded()
      Forces the phone to have its screen unlocked by executing a dedicated custom script the user has put in its device
      protected void registerScreenOffReceiver()
      Registers a broadcast receiver which is triggered when a screen-off event is broadcast
      protected void unregisterScreenOffReceiver()
      Unregisters the broadcast receiver which is triggered when a screen-off event is broadcast

        protected Activity mContext
        The application context

      • mBrScreenOff

        private BRScreenOff mBrScreenOff
        The receiver which will deal with the screen-off events

      • mIsBrScreenOffRegistered

        private boolean mIsBrScreenOffRegistered
        Flag which indicates if the broadcast receiver dedicated to screen-off events is registered

    • Constructor Detail

      • AsyncTaskForScreen

        public AsyncTaskForScreen(Activity c)
        Parameters:
        c - - The context to use, must not be null

    • Method Detail

      • forceScreenState

        protected void forceScreenState()
        Forces the screen state making the screen on and unlocking the device (if needed). It registers a receiver which will deal with screen-off events

      • forceScreenOnIfNeeded

        protected void forceScreenOnIfNeeded()
        Forces the screen's state to make it always on if needed (i.e. if the settings have the dedicated option activated). It will make the screen on and keeps it on. Wakelocks will be used to awake the screen and keep it on.

      • forceScreenUnlockIfNeeded

        protected void forceScreenUnlockIfNeeded()
        Forces the phone to have its screen unlocked by executing a dedicated custom script the user has put in its device

      • disableForceScreenOn

        protected void disableForceScreenOn()
        Disable the lock which made the screen always on

      • checkIfCancelled

        protected boolean checkIfCancelled()
        Checks if the task has been canceled or must finish. In this case the task will release the screen-always--on-lock
        Returns:
        boolean - True if the AsyncTask has been cancelled, false otherwise

      • registerScreenOffReceiver

        protected void registerScreenOffReceiver()
        Registers a broadcast receiver which is triggered when a screen-off event is broadcast

      • unregisterScreenOffReceiver

        protected void unregisterScreenOffReceiver()
        Unregisters the broadcast receiver which is triggered when a screen-off event is broadcast

      • displayToast

        protected void displayToast(java.lang.String m)
        Displays a toast with a dedicated message
        Parameters:
        m - - The message to display in a toast
